page.title: 15HOME LIFE IN AN ALMS HOUSE
page.content: There are a number of Alms Houses in the Rochester area. Foord's is in Borstal. We spoke to a lady who has lived there for two years. She said "I am free to do what I like. I can go down to the village and visit my friends. It is very peaceful and I feel safe as there is always a matron around. There is an alarm in my living room, so I am completely safe while I cook my own food and I am entirely self sufficient. I come into contact with the other residents and so I see many people. I run the library and also help with the distribution of meals to less able residents. "She told us that the oldest inmate was 102 and that now the people who live there have to pay a small sum per week for the amenities. The building was opened in 1926.
